summary: This is a search and seizure warrant issued by the U.S. District Court for the District of Virgin Islands authorizing the search of Jeffrey Epstein's private island, Little Saint James, for evidence related to sex trafficking of minors and conspiracy. The warrant details the structures on the island and specifies items to be seized, including documents, communications, photographs, and electronic devices.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Named as the owner/controller of the premises (Little Saint James Island) and the individual whose property and devices are targeted for search in relation to alleged sex trafficking offenses.

persons.name: Ruth Miller
persons.context: Issued and signed the search warrant for the premises known as Little Saint James Island.

connections.description: Judge Miller authorized the search warrant targeting Epstein's property.

events.title: Issuance of Search Warrant for Little Saint James
events.description: A federal magistrate judge issued a search warrant authorizing law enforcement to search Jeffrey Epstein's private island, Little Saint James, for evidence of sex trafficking of minors and conspiracy.

events.title: Warrant Execution Deadline
events.description: The search warrant commanded execution on or before this date.

locations: Little Saint James Island, U.S. Virgin Islands
keyFacts: The search warrant targets Epstein's private island, Little Saint James, described as approximately 75 acres with multiple structures including a main residence, several other residences, cabanas, sheds, maintenance buildings, and a dock house.

The warrant seeks evidence of violations of 18 U.S.C. §§ 1591 (Sex Trafficking of Minors) and 371 (Conspiracy), specifically items like communications with victims/co-conspirators, photographs of victims or suggestive images of teenage girls, and evidence of co-conspirators' presence on the island.
The warrant authorizes the seizure or copying of computer devices and storage media believed to be owned or used by Jeffrey Epstein, including methods to access encrypted data.
The warrant was issued by United States Magistrate Judge Ruth Miller and was to be executed by August 24, 2019.
The document lists specific structures on the island to be searched, indicating a detailed pre-raid reconnaissance of the property.
